intro: [WRONG START] Macleodium sessiliflorum subsp. sessiliflorum, commonly known as the sessile-flowered macleodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The subspecies is distinguished by its sessile flowers, which are attached directly to the stem without a stalk.
